result.execSummary:
The defendant Karen A Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Karen A Miller

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Case Called: 2:51 pm
INCLUDES 22CF585 & 20CF582.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher in person for ADA Ben Vechinski:
Defendant appears in person and with Atty Jessica Phelps in person;
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. State moves to:
20CF582:
State notes that the Defendant was on a DEOJ Agreement; Defendant has completed the DEOJ Agreement and moves to Dismiss Count 1.
Defendant has no objection.
Court Grants the State's Motion and Dismisses Count 1 pursuant to the Agreement.

22CF585:
Amend Ct. 1 to Count 1 (DC) pursuant to 947.01.

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA: 
22CF585:
Ct. 1 (DC)>> NO CONTEST.
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
22CF585:
Ct. 1 (DC)>> $250 Fine plus Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Defendant has 30 Days to pay amount in full and if unable to do so, Defendant to set up a Payment Plan with the Clerk of Court's Office. 

Adjourned: 3:01 pm
Plea hearing on August 24, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
